when native Theban dynasties emerged during the "intermediate periods"

Native Thebans are known to have controlled the royal family only from the Seventeenth and into the earlier Eighteenth Dynasties (ending with Amenhotep I). About the succeeding Thutmoside line (from which Akhenaten himself descended) nothing definite is known; but a Theban claim to be the home town of the royal family would have ended with the accession of Horemheb and then Dynasties XIX-XX (hailing from Middle and Lower Egypt respectively: see Gardiner, "The Coronation of King Haremhab," lEA 39 [1953]:21, against the Theban origin suggested for Horemheb by R

The term 'island" is to be understood not only a true island surrounded by water, but a district demarcated by clear geographic boundaries: e.g., territory between the arms of the Nile in the Delta (Wh. I 47.10); or the 'island' of Meroe in Greco-Roman writers (Diodorus Siculus i 33; Strabo i 2; Pliny vi 36), which is actually the Butana Steppe that lies between the Nile and the Atbara Rivers

and cf. the term gezira in Arabic.
